Detailed Description

OpenGL texture @detailed Adds some convenience functions and presets.

Note
GL texture coordinates wrap around, e.g. 3.1 == 0.1, 1.2334 == 0.2334 etc.

Member Function Documentation

◆ attach()

void rev::Texture::attach ( FrameBuffer &  fbo,
int  attachment,
uint32_t  depthLayer = 0 
)

Attach the texture to the specified framebuffer.

Parameters
[in]attachmentThe attachment point, e.g. GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT
[in]depthLayerFor texture arrays, the z-level of the array to attach to the framebuffer

Every subclass should redefine/override this property to return its full namespace. The built in logging methods will use this value for the message category

Member Data Documentation

◆ m_images

std::vector<Image> rev::Texture::m_images
protected

The images used for construction of this texture.

Note
A QImage is like a shared pointer, in the sense that QImages referencing the same underlying image (i.e., at the same filepath) will point to the same place in memory, and clearing one will not clear the rest.

◆ m_textureID

GLuint rev::Texture::m_textureID
protected

The OpenGL texture ID.

ID is negative 1 if not yet created in OpenGL
